Key Match Events: Cristian Javier struggled in his start, allowing three runs in the first inning.
The Astros lost Game 7 of the ALCS, ending their bid for a repeat championship.
The Texas Rangers won the series with an 11-4 victory over the Astros.
Pre-Game Insights: The Astros had a losing record at home during the regular season and playoffs, which is unusual for a team aiming to defend a championship.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Dusty Baker emphasized that the team shouldn't be ashamed of their performance.
Alex Bregman expressed disappointment over the team's execution and the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros' loss marked the first time a team with a losing home record advanced to the World Series in 20 years.
The game was the final and deciding match of the ALCS.
